text: The 2009 IIHF World Women's U18 Championship Division I tournament was held in Chambéry, France, from 28 December 2008 to 2 January 2009.Division I Statistics This was the first junior female Division One ice hockey world championship in history. ==Final standings== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" |- !width=165|Team !width=40|GP !width=40|W !width=40|OTW !width=40|OTL !width=40|L !width=40|GF !width=40|GA !width=40|PTS |- style="background:#cfc;" |style="text-align:left;"| |4||4||0||0||0||18||5||12 |- |style="text-align:left;"| |4||2||1||0||1||9||7||8 |- |style="text- align:left;"| |4||2||0||1||1||11||14||7 |- |style="text-align:left;"| |4||1||0||0||3||8||13||3 |- |style="text-align:left;"| |4||0||0||0||4||9||16||0 |} is promoted to the Top Division of the 2010 IIHF World Women's U18 Championship. ==Results== All times are local (CET – UTC+01:00). ==References== Category:IIHF World Women's U18 Championship – Division I World World Category:International ice hockey competitions hosted by France
title: 2009 IIHF World Women's U18 Championship – Division I
